availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Louis H. Chrisman (sheriff of Jessamine County)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, sheriff and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Hester Chrisman. Father of Lucy J. Chrisman, Addison L. Chrisman, Anna T. Chrisman, Margaret P. Chrisman, and George L. Chrisman. Founding member of the Jessamine Female Institute in 1854. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1860. Served as sheriff of Jessamine County from 1858 to 1860. Captain of the Jessamine County Home Guard in 1861. Served as a volunteer aid to General William R. Terrell of the United States Army.

bibl.p: Bennett H. Young, A History of Jessamine County, Kentucky: From its Earliest Settlement to 1898 (Louisville: Courier-Journal Job Printing Company, 1898), 176 and 243; _Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 76; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 18; KYR-0002-022-0067.
